description: Borrowed from French véhicule, from Latin vehiculum (“a carriage, conveyance”), from vehere (“to carry”).

entries.meaning: A conveyance; a device for carrying or transporting substances, objects or individuals.
A medium for expression of talent or views.
examples: supporting actors in a Steven Spielberg vehicle

entries.meaning: A liquid content (e.g. oil) which acts as a binding and drying agent in paint.
(pharmaceuticals) The main excipient (such as an oil or gel) that conveys the active ingredient of a drug.
examples: an ointment with a petrolatum vehicle

entries.meaning: An entity to achieve an end.
examples: mission service as a vehicle for development of better-rounded worldviews

entries.meaning: (Buddhism) A mode or method of spiritual practice; a yana.
(Hinduism) An animal or (rarely) a plant on which a Hindu deity rides or sits.
